intro: Sida decandra, commonly known as the many-stemmed sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its branching stems and small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually ovate or lanceolate, with a rough texture. Sida decandra is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
